p: LASV belongs to the Mammarenavirus genus (member of the Arenaviridae family) ( 8), a genus of enveloped, negative-strand RNA viruses that can be divided into two groups: Old World (OW) and New World (NW) ( 9). The OW family of arenaviruses includes LASV and lymphocytic choriomeningitis virus (LCMV), a neglected human pathogen distributed worldwide ( 10, 11), while the NW family of arenaviruses includes Jun√≠n virus (JUNV) and Machupo virus (MACV), the causative agents of Argentine hemorrhagic fever and Bolivian hemorrhagic fever, respectively ( 9).
